text: They left Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: There on the plains of Moab they camped along the Jordan from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho the Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you. Destroy all their carved images and their cast idols, and demolish all their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Distribute the land by lot, according to your clans. To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one. Whatever falls to them by lot will be theirs. Distribute it according to your ancestral tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land, those you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will give you trouble in the land where you will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then I will do to you what I plan to do to them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you enter Canaan, the land that will be allotted to you as an inheritance is to have these boundaries:
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Your southern side will include some of the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom. Your southern boundary will start in the east from the southern end of the Dead Sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: cross south of Scorpion Pass, continue on to Zin and go south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: where it will turn, join the Wadi of Egypt and end at the Mediterranean Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Your western boundary will be the coast of the Mediterranean Sea. This will be your boundary on the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘For your northern boundary, run a line from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Mount Hor to Lebo Hamath. Then the boundary will go to Zedad,
speaker: Narrator

text: continue to Ziphron and end at Hazar Enan. This will be your boundary on the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘For your eastern boundary, run a line from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The boundary will go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and continue along the slopes east of the Sea of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the boundary will go down along the Jordan and end at the Dead Sea.
“‘This will be your land, with its boundaries on every side.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the Israelites: “Assign this land by lot as an inheritance. The Lord has ordered that it be given to the nine and a half tribes,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the families of the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: These two and a half tribes have received their inheritance east of the Jordan across from Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the names of the men who are to assign the land for you as an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And appoint one leader from each tribe to help assign the land.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites to give the Levites towns to live in from the inheritance the Israelites will possess. And give them pasturelands around the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will have towns to live in and pasturelands for the cattle they own and all their other animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The pasturelands around the towns that you give the Levites will extend a thousand cubits from the town wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Outside the town, measure two thousand cubits on the east side, two thousand on the south side, two thousand on the west and two thousand on the north, with the town in the center. They will have this area as pastureland for the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Six of the towns you give the Levites will be cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone may flee. In addition, give them forty-two other towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all you must give the Levites forty-eight towns, together with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns you give the Levites from the land the Israelites possess are to be given in proportion to the inheritance of each tribe: Take many towns from a tribe that has many, but few from one that has few.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: select some towns to be your cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone accidentally may flee.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be places of refuge from the avenger, so that anyone accused of murder may not die before they stand trial before the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six towns you give will be your cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give three on this side of the Jordan and three in Canaan as cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six towns will be a place of refuge for Israelites and for foreigners residing among them, so that anyone who has killed another accidentally can flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘If anyone strikes someone a fatal blow with an iron object, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if anyone is holding a stone and strikes someone a fatal blow with it, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if anyone is holding a wooden object and strikes someone a fatal blow with it, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death; when the avenger comes upon the murderer, the avenger shall put the murderer to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone with malice aforethought shoves another or throws something at them intentionally so that they die
speaker: Narrator

text: or if out of enmity one person hits another with their fist so that the other dies, that person is to be put to death; that person is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when they meet.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if without enmity someone suddenly pushes another or throws something at them unintentionally
speaker: Narrator

text: or, without seeing them, drops on them a stone heavy enough to kill them, and they die, then since that other person was not an enemy and no harm was intended,
speaker: Narrator

text: the assembly must judge between the accused and the avenger of blood according to these regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The assembly must protect the one accused of murder from the avenger of blood and send the accused back to the city of refuge to which they fled. The accused must stay there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if the accused ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which they fled
speaker: Narrator

text: and the avenger of blood finds them outside the city, the avenger of blood may kill the accused without being guilty of murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: The accused must stay in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest; only after the death of the high priest may they return to their own property.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘This is to have the force of law for you throughout the generations to come, wherever you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Anyone who kills a person is to be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of witnesses. But no one is to be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Do not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer, who deserves to die. They are to be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Do not accept a ransom for anyone who has fled to a city of refuge and so allow them to go back and live on their own land before the death of the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘Do not pollute the land where you are. Bloodshed pollutes the land, and atonement cannot be made for the land on which blood has been shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not defile the land where you live and where I dwell, for I, the Lord, dwell among the Israelites.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The family heads of the clan of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, who were from the clans of the descendants of Joseph, came and spoke before Moses and the leaders, the heads of the Israelite families.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “When the Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance to the Israelites by lot, he ordered you to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now suppose they marry men from other Israelite tribes; then their inheritance will be taken from our ancestral inheritance and added to that of the tribe they marry into. And so part of the inheritance allotted to us will be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Year of Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe into which they marry, and their property will be taken from the tribal inheritance of our ancestors.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then at the Lord’s command Moses gave this order to the Israelites: “What the tribe of the descendants of Joseph is saying is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord commands for Zelophehad’s daughters: They may marry anyone they please as long as they marry within their father’s tribal clan.
speaker: Narrator

text: No inheritance in Israel is to pass from one tribe to another, for every Israelite shall keep the tribal inheritance of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter who inherits land in any Israelite tribe must marry someone in her father’s tribal clan, so that every Israelite will possess the inheritance of their ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: No inheritance may pass from one tribe to another, for each Israelite tribe is to keep the land it inherits.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Zelophehad’s daughters did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelophehad’s daughters—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milkah and Noah—married their cousins on their father’s side.
speaker: Narrator

text: They married within the clans of the descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in their father’s tribe and clan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commands and regulations the Lord gave through Moses to the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
